Title: Data Engineer - Malta
text:
Company Overview




Swish Analytics is a sports analytics, betting and fantasy startup building the next generation of predictive sports analytics data products. We believe that oddsmaking is a challenge rooted in engineering, mathematics, and sports betting expertise; not intuition. We're looking for team-oriented individuals with an authentic passion for accurate and predictive real-time data who can execute in a fast-paced, creative, and continually-evolving environment without sacrificing technical excellence. Our challenges are unique, so we hope you are comfortable in uncharted territory and passionate about building systems to support products across a variety of industries and consumer/enterprise clients.




Job Description




The Swish Analytics team is seeking Data Engineers based in Europe to have a direct impact on the infrastructure and delivery of our core consumer and enterprise data offerings as well as helping support our coverage of non-US sports. We're a team passionate about accurate predictions and real-time data, and hope you find satisfaction in building new products with the latest and greatest technologies. This is a remote position.




Duties




Support production systems and help triage issues during live sporting events
Architect low-latency, real-time analytics systems including raw data collection, feature development and endpoint production
Build new sports betting data products and predictions offerings
Integrate large and complex real-time datasets into new consumer and enterprise products
Develop production-level predictive analytics into enterprise-grade APIs
Contribute to the design and implementation of new, fully-automated sports data delivery frameworks




Requirements




BS/BA degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or related STEM field
Minimum of 2+ years of demonstrated experience writing production level code (Python)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (preferably MySQL) Demonstrated experience with Airflow
Demonstrated experience with Kubernetes
Experience building end-to-end ETL pipelines
Experience utilizing REST APIs
Experience with version control (git), continuous integration and deployment, shell scripting, and cloud-computing infrastructures (AWS)
Experience with web scraping and cleaning unstructured data
Knowledge of data science and machine learning concepts
A strong interest for sports and sports betting, with an emphasis on Tennis. An understanding of US-based sports including the NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, College Football, College Basketball, and the ability use your knowledge of the sport to inform your work with complex datasets




Swish Analytics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All candidates who meet the qualifications will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy status, genetic, military, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. The position responsibilities are not limited to the responsibilities outlined above and are subject to change. At the employer's discretion, this position may require successful completion of background and reference checks.

Title: Data Engineer ( Remote / Fulltime /  SaaS ) € 3.781 - € 5.633 per maand, Oldenzaal
text:
Wat doet WePublish?

WePublish digitaliseert de reclamefolder markt. De afgelopen 5 jaar is WePublish dé plek voor de grootste retailers van Nederland (bijv. Action, HEMA, Blokker, GAMMA en ICI Paris XL) om hun reclamefolders te digitaliseren. Het gebruik van data uit reclamefolders is uitgegroeid tot een belangrijke bron van inzicht voor folder managers, maar ook promotie managers binnen retail organisaties. Inmiddels vergaard WePublish op grote schaal reclamefolder data. Zowel op de website van retailers als vanuit het eigen consumenten platform Folders.

Door onze slimme techniek die in onze eigen viewer is gebouwd, vergaren we bakken data over de eindgebruiker, weten we precies hoe een gebruiker door een online folder leest en zijn we in staat hier op in te spelen. We verwerven de data uit de online folders die gepubliceerd worden en vertalen dit door naar naar concrete adviezen aan onze klanten. Onze leesgedrag analyses, dashboards en rapporten geven een beeld over het gedrag van de eindgebruiker in de folder van de retailers. Als je wilt werken in een informele organisatie met veel vrijheid, dan passen we bij elkaar. Wij als organisatie willen zo flexibel mogelijk met elkaar omgaan, mits jij op de juiste momenten ook je verantwoordelijkheid pakt. Wij zijn een hecht team met een mooie balans tussen aanpakken en hard werken, en gezelligheid. Daarnaast bieden wij veel doorgroeimogelijkheden of kansen om het data team uit te breiden als klanten steeds meer data willen afnemen.

Wat ga jij als Data engineer bij WePublish precies doen?

Als Data Engineer zal je verantwoordelijk zijn voor het koppelen en ontsluiten van externe databronnen, de opslag van ongestructureerde data binnen het datalake (voor het verzamelen van de data) en interne / externe bronnen combineren. Samen met het team werk je op een Agile wijze en zal je gebruik gaan maken van de nieuwste Microsoft technieken. We zijn onlangs gemigreerd naar het Microsoft Azure cloudplatform, hebben een groot data lake en maken gebruik van Power BI als dashboarding tool. We zoeken iemand die het datalake en dienstverlening samen ontdekt, optimaliseert en nieuwe inzichten weet te vergaren. Dit doe je natuurlijk samen met het team.

Beschik je niet precies over onderstaande kennis maar heb je wel een aantal jaren ervaring als Data Engineer opgedaan, dan komen we ook graag met je in gesprek.

Functie-eisen

Wat vragen we van jou?

Je hebt minimaal HBO+ werk en denkniveau
Zelfstartende en hands-on mentaliteit
Ervaring als Data Engineer
Kennis van datawarehouses / databases (Microsoft SQL, MySQL) , het modelleren van data (Datavault/Kimball), Cloud technieken (Azure)
ETL tooling (bijv. Azure Data Factory)
Ervaring met SQL en NoSQL
Gewerkt met Visualisatie tooling (PowerBI / Tableau / Data Studio).
Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?
Een prima salaris afhankelijk van je werkervaring: Een salaris tussen de €3,781 en €5,633
Werkweek van 32 – 40 uur
Zelf in charge over je werktijden
25 vakantiedagen (mogelijkheid het het extra bijkopen van vakantiedagen, tot max 3 weken)
Je krijgt de vrijheid om met het team mee te denken en je te blijven ontwikkelen. Sterker nog: we denken daarin graag met je mee.
Je mag natuurlijk ook heel graag langs komen op ons kantoor in Oldenzaal. Iedereen is altijd welkom.
Als je op kantoor komt, kan je je uitleven met tafelvoetbal of met een potje poolen.
Na het werk kun je ook samen met je collega’s naar de sportschool (sommige collega’s gaan twee keer per week samen naar de sportschool).

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
text:
Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt zur Erweiterung unseres Data Teams einen weiteren Data Engineer.




We are looking to expand our Data Team with an additional Data Engineer who can start as soon as possible.




Aufgaben




Du pflegst und erweiterst unsere Datenpipelines und unser Datawarehouse
Du liebst es, Datenprodukte in Zusammenarbeit mit Datenanalysten und Data Scientists zu entwerfen, zu entwickeln und zu pflegen
Du integrierst neue Datenquellen und restrukturierst unsere aktuellen Datenpipelines, um die Performance und Skalierbarkeit zu verbessern
Du arbeitest mit unseren Data Engineers zusammen, um ein Data Monitoring zu entwickeln, um die Zuverlässigkeit und Qualität unserer Daten zu verbessern
Du arbeitest mit unseren Data Scientists zusammen, um eine Recommendation Engine, die wir von Grund auf neu erstellen, zu erweitern und zu skalieren
You will maintain and expand our data pipelines and our data warehouse
You love to design, develop and maintain data products in collaboration with Data Analysts and Data Scientists
You will Integrate new data sources and restructure our current data pipelines to improve performance and scalability
You will collaborate with our Data Engineers to develop a Data Monitoring system to improve the reliability and quality of our data
You will collaborate with our Data Scientists to expand and scale a Recommendation Engine that we are building from scratch




Qualifikation




3-4 Jahre Erfahrung im Aufbau und der Pflege von Data Warehouses und der Durchführung von Data Modeling
Sehr starke SQL- und Python-Kenntnisse (unser aktueller ETL-Stack besteht aus SQL-Skripten, die von mara-etl ausgeführt werden - einem Python-basierten ETL-Framework)
Du arbeitest gerne im Team und führst Projekte in fokussierten, inkrementellen Schritten durch
fließend Englisch und Deutsch (~B2 für beide ist ausreichend)
3-4 years experience building and maintaining data warehouses and performing data modeling
Very strong SQL and Python skills (our current ETL stack consists of SQL scripts executed by mara-etl, a lightweight Python-based ETL framework)
You enjoy working in a team, and completing projects in focused, incremental steps
Reasonably fluent in English and German (~B2 for both is acceptable)




Benefits




Gesundheit – Wir leben unser Produkt. Daher stellen wir dir ein jährliches Budget für Gesundheitskurse sowie -equipment zur Verfügung
Work-Life-Balance – Du erhältst einen unbefristetet Arbeitsvertrag, 28 Tage Urlaub p.a. + 1 Tag für ehrenamtliche Tätigkeiten, flexible Arbeitszeiten. Ein selbst bestimmtes Hybrid-Arbeitsmodell (remote oder Office) bieten dir die Möglichkeit, einen Ausgleich zwischen Berufs- und Privatleben zu schaffen
Teamspirit – Unser passioniertes Team freut sich schon auf dich. Durch regelmäßige Teamevents stärken wir unsere Bindung und Zusammenarbeit
Health - We are living our product. That is why we offer you a budget to be used for health and fitness courses as well as equipment
Work-Life-Balance - You receive an unlimited contract, 28 days of vacation plus 1 day for community service and flexible working hours. An individual working modell (remote or at the office) offers you the opportunity to find a balance between working and private life.
Team Spirit - Our passionate team is eager to meet you. We strengthen our bond and cooperation through regular team events.

Title: Data DevOps Engineer
text:
The role




Our centralized Production Operations team is expanding and thus, we are keen to identify a Devops specialist who has a strong interest in Big Data.




GiG harnesses the power of Big Data across the iGaming ecosystem and this role would be key to help maintain and improve on the existing solution that is constantly evolving according to business requirements.




You’d be really excited to:




Script different isolated environments such as an environment for QA, Production, Staging and User Acceptance Testing Environments in an agnostic way.
Maintain and improve the governance of existing Data Stack, ranging from Data Engineering Tools, Data Science Modelling and also Business Intelligence reporting toolsets.
Develop processes for the development teams so that features can be automatically tested and merged to one code base.
Setting up and maintaining platforms such as ticketing systems to manage requests from different verticals within the company.
Responsible for administration of permissions throughout the team.
Doing POCs with different approaches for automation of deployments with cutting edge technologies such as Clickhouse, Apache Spark, Confluent platform (using mainly Avro, KSQL, Kafka Connect and Kafka), Apache Ignite, Apache NiFi and NiFi Registry.
Suggest tools for increased productivity, security, reliability, and performance.
Maintain and develop tools and agents such as Grafana for performance monitoring, security monitoring.
Use Grafana for monitoring our applications.
Help with CI/CD processes.
Maintain kubernetes clusters that support our Spark and Spring containerised applications.
Work with third parties for guidance and systems integration using best practices with tools such as Clickhouse or Kafka.
Provide guidance and direction to the development team and follow best practices
Enhance current code stack to help with automation, versioning, tags and automation of Pipelines.




Who you are:




Hold a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Experience in this role or automation with Apache Projects
Have worked with both Linux and Windows environments
A strong background in Big Data, technologies such as HDFS, Hadoop, HDFS, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Apache NiFi.
A strong understanding of DevOps methodologies and concepts.
Strong infrastructure knowledge on cloud platform providers such as Azure, GCP or AWS.
Fluent with UNIX

Title: Data Engineer
text:
PASO SOLUTIONS ist ein aufstrebendes und schnell wachsendes Unternehmen mit Standorten in Hohenzell, Graz und Landau in der Pfalz. Wir sind ein agiles Team bestehend aus engagierten Solutions Consultants, Architects und Engineers. Gemeinsam entwickeln wir individuelle Business Analytics & Software Lösungen für unsere langjährigen nationalen und internationalen Kunden in den Bereichen Automotive und Anlagenbau und treiben innovative Technologien voran.




Du bist stolz ein DATA ENGINEER zu sein? Wir auch! Entwickle mit uns gemeinsam Data Warehouses, Business Intelligence und Analytics Lösungen. Werde ab sofort in VZ ein Teil unseres engagierten Teams in Hohenzell oder Graz als




Senior Data Engineer




für Data Warehouses, Business Intelligence und Analytics (m,w,d)




Aufgaben




Entwicklung von Data Warehouses, Business Intelligence und Analytics Lösungen
Sammeln, generieren und auswählen von relevanten Daten in Quellsystemen
Modellieren der Daten für die effiziente Speicherung und schnelle Abfrage
Aufbereitung von Daten und Berechnung von Kennzahlen für Berichte und Dashboards
Verantwortung über eigene Arbeitspakete bzw. anteiliges Projektmanagement
Entwicklung von Schnittstellen für Daten- und Systemintegration





Qualifikation




Interesse an Data Engineering, Data Analytics und Data Science
Idealerweise einschlägige Ausbildung oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrung
Kenntnisse in SQL und Datenbanken (z.B. SQL Server, T-SQL)
Erfahrungen mit DWH und BI von Vorteil (z.B. ETL, SSIS/SSAS/SSRS, Power BI)
Bereitschaft zum ständigen Lernen und zur fachlichen Weiterbildung
Kommunikative Persönlichkeit, Flexibilität und Lösungsorientierung
Gute Deutschkenntnisse und Teamspirit





Benefits




Spannende Projekte und Herausforderungen passend zu deinem technischen Skillset
Hohe gestalterische Möglichkeiten, breites Aufgabengebiet und selbstbestimmtes





Arbeiten nach deinen Wünschen
Mitgestaltung in einem selbstgesteuerten Team aus stolzen Data Engineers
Freie Zeiteinteilung (Gleitzeit ohne Kernzeit, Home-Office an bis zu drei Tagen)
Individuell auf dich zugeschnittene Weiterbildung (Kurse, Zertifikate, Workshops, …)





Abhängig von deiner Berufserfahrung beginnt das kollektiv-vertragliche Mindestgehalt




(IT-Kollektivvertrag, ST1) bei € 2.589 für Berufseinsteiger bzw. bei € 3.190




mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung. Selbstverständlich bieten wir dir eine




attraktive Überzahlung entsprechend deiner Qualifikationen. Gerne erzählen wir




dir bei einem persönlichen Gespräch mehr von uns. Sende uns deinen Lebenslauf




und Kontaktdaten. Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Title: Beca - Ingeniero/a de Datos
text:
Aegon desea contar con un/a estudiante, con interés en conocer y desarrollar su aprendizaje en el Area de Integración de Datos y Big Data, capaz de contribuir al desarrollo de la plataforma Informacional de la compañía, definiendo e implementando las especificaciones necesarias para el correcto diseño, procesamiento, integración, trazabilidad y calidad de los datos.

¿Qué Buscamos?

Estudiante de Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Licenciado/a en Matemáticas o equivalente.

Conocimientos en el tratamiento y consulta de Bases de Datos (SQL).

Deseable conocimiento en Modelado de Bases de Datos analíticas Multidimensionales (Data Warehouse). Entornos BigData y DataLakes.

Personas con ganas de aprender y de evolucionar.

Funciones

Parte del equipo de Ingenieros de Datos, del Area Data Integration, dentro del Departamento de Tecnología de AEGON España.
Desarrollo con herramientas de Integración y procesamiento de Datos, BigData y Servicios Cloud, Amazon Web Services: Informatica BDM, Amazon S3, Amazon Athena, Amazon Redshift, Spectrum, PostgreSQL, DBeaver.
Definición e implementación de los procesos de Integración de datos.
Definición e implementación de los procesos de Calidad de datos.
Colaboración de forma activa con los diferentes departamentos, y trato directo con el cliente, en los diferentes proyectos de datos.


Competencias

Gusto por la calidad y la excelencia.
Espíritu crítico orientado a la mejora continua
Compromiso y Proactividad
Trabajo en equipo y cooperación


Otros datos

Duración de 6 meses
Beca retribuida
Flexibilidad horaria 5 horas al día, de lunes a viernes, idealmente en horario de mañana.
Trabajo híbrido (2 dias oficina + 3 teletrabajo)

Title: Data Engineer H/F
text:
Chez OP-Rate, nous avons à coeur de faire évoluer nos collaborateurs dans leur montée en compétences sur des projets toujours plus ambitieux et de les faire participer entièrement à la vie de l'entreprise.

Nous aidons depuis 2017 les startups, PME et Grandes Entreprises à accélérer leur croissance du Cloud en facilitant le passage à l'échelle de leur charge de travail et en construisant des plateformes de données capable de répondre à leur enjeux business.

Nos domaines de compétences : Lift and Shift, modernisation d'infrastructure et d'applications. Création de Data platform.

Dans le cadre son développement, OP-RATE s'implante dans votre région, afin d' être au plus proche de ses Teams existantes et futures.

Pour renforcer notre Core Team et répondre aux besoins de nos clients nous recherchons un Data Engineer Junior (H/F), vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec le Data Engineer Senior(H/F)

Votre rôle consiste à créer des pipelines et des plateformes de données sur des environnements cloud.

Vous travaillez en équipe et intervenez de la phase de Design à la phase de Build pour :

Modéliser des données dans des systèmes relationnels (CloudSQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL) mais aussi NoSQL (MongoDB, BigQuery, BigTable)
Développer des programmes de collecte de données en Python
Développer des API permettant l'accès aux données produites
Coder dans le respect des procédures et des normes

De préférence ingénieur.e de formation, vous êtes attiré.e par les missions Data et le développement python/Spark.

Expérience : 3 ans minimum

Vous maitrisez SQL et 1 langage de programmation comme Java ou Python.

Vous connaissez les concepts ETL/ELT et DataWarehouse.

Vous avez des connaissances/ ou une première expèrience significative sur Spark, Hadoop, des frameworks de streaming (Bean, Flink, Spark streaming)

Vous êtes passionné.e, curieux.se et autonome.

Poste en FULL REMOTE pour débuter l'aventure, proche Rennes (facile d'accés). Par la suite l'hybride ou sur site vous sera proposé.e.s.

Nous répondons à un besoin " humain" de nos équipes. ADAPTER LES CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL EN FONCTION DU RYTHME DE VIE DE CHACUNES ET CHACUNS :)

Title: Data Engineer | Must have: SDL Database design, dbt, Apache Airflow and Snowflake.
text:
WHAT YOU’LL DO




Active execution and monitoring of complex data engineering pipelines for financial data warehouse.
Architect, Design, document & implement the data pipelines to feed data models for subsequent consumption in Snowflake using dbt, airflow.
Ensure correctness and completeness of the data being transformed via engineering pipelines for end consumption in Analytical Dashboards.
Actively monitor and triage technical challenges in critical situations that require immediate resolution.
Evaluate viable technical solutions and share MVPs or PoCs in support of the research
Develop relationships with external stakeholders to maintain awareness of data and security issues and trends
Review work from other tech team members and provide feedback for growth
Implement Data Performance, Data security policies that align with governance objectives and regulatory requirements




YOU’RE GOOD AT




You have experience in data warehousing, data modelling, and the building of data engineering pipelines. You are well versed in data engineering methods, such as ETL and ELT techniques through scripting and/or tooling. You are good in analyzing performance bottlenecks and providing enhancement recommendations; you have a passion for customer service and a desire to learn and grow as a professional and a technologist.

Strong analytical skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Collaborating with product owners to identify requirements, define desired outcomes and deliver trusted results.
Building processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
In this role, SQL is heavily focused. An ideal candidate must have hands-on experience with SQL database design. Plus, Python.
Demonstrably deep understanding of SQL (level: advanced) and analytical data warehouses (Snowflake preferred).
Demonstrated ability to write new code i.e., well-documented and stored in a version control system (we use GitHub & Bitbucket)
Extremely talented in applying SCD, CDC and DQ/DV framework.
Familiar with JIRA & Confluence.
Must have exposure to technologies such as dbt, Apache airflow and Snowflake.
Desire to continually keep up with advancements in data engineering practices.
Knowledge on AWS cloud is a plus.




YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)




Essential Education




Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Bachelor's degree in information science, data management, computer science or related field preferred.

Essential Experience & Job Requirements




7+ years of IT experience with major focus on data warehouse/database related projects
Must have exposure to technologies such as dbt, Apache Airflow, Snowflake.
Experience in data platforms: Snowflake, Oracle, SQL Server, MDM etc
Expertise in writing SQL and database objects - Stored procedures, functions, views. Hands on experience in ETL/ELT and data security, SQL performance optimization and job orchestration tools and technologies e.g., dbt, Attunity, Golden Gate, APIs, Apache Airflow etc.
Experience in data modelling and relational database design
Well versed in applying SCD, CDC and DQ/DV framework
Demonstrate ability to write new code i.e., well-documented and stored in a version control system (we use GitHub & Bitbucket)
Good to have experience with Cloud Platforms such as AWS, Azure, GCP and Snowflake
Good to have strong programming/ scripting skills (Python, PowerShell, etc.)
Good to have knowledge around developing financial models and forecasting to support financial planning, and decision-making processes.
Experience around responsibility for analyzing and interpreting financial data to provide valuable insights and support strategic decision-making.
Experience working with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and Meta Scrum with cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Master, Architects, and data SMEs)
Excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills to present architecture, features, and solution recommendations




YOU’LL WORK WITH




Global functional product portfolio technical leaders (Finance, HR, Marketing, Legal, Risk, IT), product owners, functional area teams across levels
Global Data Product Portfolio Management & teams (Enterprise Data Model, Data Catalog, Master Data Management)
Consulting and internal Data Product Portfolio teams across BCG

Title: Data Engineer | T- SQL | ETL | Azure - 100% Remoto
text:
Job Description




We are looking for the very Top Talent…and we would be delighted if you were to join our team!




More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer company with over 29.000 employees all over the world and presence in more than 30 countries. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies.




What we look for?




We are looking for a Data Engineer with expertise in data analysis, data modelling and designing ETL processes, expert in T-SQL and Azure platform. You will work with one of our main clients leader in the financial sector. The position is fully remote.




Main Tasks And Accountabilities Will Be




Work with stakeholders within business and technology to understand the business needs and help to design and implement optimal solutions fostering data-driven culture in the organisation
Lead strategic prototyping workshops to better understand objectives through quick feedback loops and collaborate effectively across Global Technology Shared Services (InfoSec, Infrastructure, Production Support, etc) to productionise the successful solutions
Understand differences in the approach for building self-service BI (business or IT managed) vs Corporate BI solutions including the choice of data sources and ETL approach
Drive reporting efficiencies by categorizing internal practices for streamlined reporting and define a vehicle for sharing with others, including trainings for Power BI report designers and data modellers, as well as for Power BI report consumers
Act as a Power BI product evangelist to build awareness and understanding, be up to date with the changing technology landscape, help to better understand the use cases for the Power Solutions including when the alternatives would be a better fit.
Contribute into the Power Platform centre of excellence within the firm to create the governance structure for the implementation of PowerBI
Assess adoption and customer satisfaction working collaboratively with product teams including UX specialists, monitor user analytics to understand the user behaviour patterns and improve solutions
Be a change ambassador open to collaboration on all levels with a creative approach to each problem




The Knowledge, Experience And Qualifications You Need




English C1.
Highly skilled in data analysis, data modelling and designing ETL processes
Expert at T-SQL with experience in performance tuning and dealing with large data volumes
Good understanding on concepts of enterprise big data architectures Extensive experience of developing reporting and analytics solutions. This includes Azure Synapse, Azure SQL Database, SSAS.
Knowledge of Azure platform including Data Lakes, Data Warehouse , Azure Data Factory.
Additional knowledge of Azure Data Catalog, Master Data Services, and Data Quality Services is an advantage.
Experience and good understanding of the full Software Development Lifecycle, including the use of Azure Dev Ops, Visual Studio (SSDT) for continuous integration and deployment Understanding security model designs within the data estate




The Knowledge, Experience And Qualifications That Will Help




Experience in building reporting governance framework and driving the adoption within the organisation is highly beneficial
Experience of implementation of other Power Platform solutions (Power Automate, Power Apps) is an advantage
Experience of SAFe working practices is desirable E
xperience in consuming data using data interfaces such as APIs, snowflake , Databases, various file format types.
Understanding of Data Quality approaches such as shift left




Valuable and desirable: being entitled of Disability Certificate (at least 33% score)




What can we offer?




23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!
Numerous benefits (Health Care Plan, teleworking compensation, Life and Accident Insurances).
`Retribución Flexible´ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Health Care Plan…)
Free access to several training platforms
Professional stability and career plans
UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.
The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments along the year.
Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH or remote work policy, compacted hours during summertime…)
UST Club Platform discounts and gym Access discounts




If you would like to know more, don’t hesitate to apply and we’ll get in touch to fill you in detail. We are waiting for you!

Title: Data Engineer | Must have: SDL Database design, dbt, Apache Airflow and Snowflake.
text:
WHAT YOU’LL DO




Active execution and monitoring of complex data engineering pipelines for financial data warehouse.
Architect, Design, document & implement the data pipelines to feed data models for subsequent consumption in Snowflake using dbt, airflow.
Ensure correctness and completeness of the data being transformed via engineering pipelines for end consumption in Analytical Dashboards.
Actively monitor and triage technical challenges in critical situations that require immediate resolution.
Evaluate viable technical solutions and share MVPs or PoCs in support of the research
Develop relationships with external stakeholders to maintain awareness of data and security issues and trends
Review work from other tech team members and provide feedback for growth
Implement Data Performance, Data security policies that align with governance objectives and regulatory requirements




YOU’RE GOOD AT




You have experience in data warehousing, data modelling, and the building of data engineering pipelines. You are well versed in data engineering methods, such as ETL and ELT techniques through scripting and/or tooling. You are good in analyzing performance bottlenecks and providing enhancement recommendations; you have a passion for customer service and a desire to learn and grow as a professional and a technologist.

Strong analytical skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Collaborating with product owners to identify requirements, define desired outcomes and deliver trusted results.
Building processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
In this role, SQL is heavily focused. An ideal candidate must have hands-on experience with SQL database design. Plus, Python.
Demonstrably deep understanding of SQL (level: advanced) and analytical data warehouses (Snowflake preferred).
Demonstrated ability to write new code i.e., well-documented and stored in a version control system (we use GitHub & Bitbucket)
Extremely talented in applying SCD, CDC and DQ/DV framework.
Familiar with JIRA & Confluence.
Must have exposure to technologies such as dbt, Apache airflow and Snowflake.
Desire to continually keep up with advancements in data engineering practices.
Knowledge on AWS cloud is a plus.




YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)




Essential Education




Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Bachelor's degree in information science, data management, computer science or related field preferred.

Essential Experience & Job Requirements




7+ years of IT experience with major focus on data warehouse/database related projects
Must have exposure to technologies such as dbt, Apache Airflow, Snowflake.
Experience in data platforms: Snowflake, Oracle, SQL Server, MDM etc
Expertise in writing SQL and database objects - Stored procedures, functions, views. Hands on experience in ETL/ELT and data security, SQL performance optimization and job orchestration tools and technologies e.g., dbt, Attunity, Golden Gate, APIs, Apache Airflow etc.
Experience in data modelling and relational database design
Well versed in applying SCD, CDC and DQ/DV framework
Demonstrate ability to write new code i.e., well-documented and stored in a version control system (we use GitHub & Bitbucket)
Good to have experience with Cloud Platforms such as AWS, Azure, GCP and Snowflake
Good to have strong programming/ scripting skills (Python, PowerShell, etc.)
Good to have knowledge around developing financial models and forecasting to support financial planning, and decision-making processes.
Experience around responsibility for analyzing and interpreting financial data to provide valuable insights and support strategic decision-making.
Experience working with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and Meta Scrum with cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Master, Architects, and data SMEs)
Excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills to present architecture, features, and solution recommendations




YOU’LL WORK WITH




Global functional product portfolio technical leaders (Finance, HR, Marketing, Legal, Risk, IT), product owners, functional area teams across levels
Global Data Product Portfolio Management & teams (Enterprise Data Model, Data Catalog, Master Data Management)
Consulting and internal Data Product Portfolio teams across BCG

Title: Data Engineer SQL Server, Tableau (100% remoto)
text:
Job Description




¡Seguimos buscando talento…y nos encantaría que te unieras a nuestro equipo!




Para que nos conozcas algo mejor, UST es una multinacional norteamericana certificada como Top Employer con más de 30.000 empleados a nivel global y con presencia en más de 30 países. Somos líderes en servicios de tecnología digital y proporcionamos soluciones tecnológicas de gran alcance a grandes compañías.




¿Qué buscamos?




En UST y para nuestro área de Global Accounts, estamos buscando un/a Data Engineer SQL Server con Tableau, valorándose experiencia también en desarrollo con .NET, con un nivel avanzado de inglés, para participar en diversos proyectos de carácter internacional y dentro de un equipo multidisciplinar internacional, con posibilidad de trabajar en remoto.




Modalidad de trabajo: 100% remoto desde cualquier provincia de España, con disponibilidad para viajar, si lo solicita el cliente (<20%)

Horario de oficina: Lunes a Viernes de 08:00 a 17:00 horas

Funciones

Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los usuarios para analizar y convertir los requisitos funcionales, empresariales y técnicos en soluciones flexibles y estratégicas.

Realizar análisis de datos para apoyar el requisito y evaluar la viabilidad de la solución.

Contribuir a la planificación ágil creando, refinando, dimensionando y analizando las historias de usuario en tareas realizables.

Ser curioso y cuestionar los diseños y soluciones nuevos y existentes para permitir mejoras continuas.

Ofrecer consultoría de datos a las partes interesadas del negocio y la tecnología.

Requisito Indispensable

Sólido desarrollo de bases de datos SQL Server. (mínimo 6 años de experiencia)

Ingestión de datos.

Optimización de consultas.

Ajuste de rendimiento.

Modelado de datos.

Cualquier herramienta de visualización de datos: Tableau (opción preferente), Power BI, SSRS

Muy buenas habilidades de comunicación.

Debe ser capaz de hablar con las diferentes partes interesadas para aclarar los requisitos y asegurarse de que el desarrollo coincide con la visión de negocio.

Mentalidad analítica.

Deseable y Valorable

Experiencia en desarrollo .Net y Azure.

Familiarizado con metodologías ágiles de entrega (idealmente SAFe)

Experiencia en DevOps, despliegues automatizados y herramientas de control de código fuente (idealmente Azure DevOps, Octopus Deploy y GIT).

Conocimiento de técnicas de automatización de pruebas como TDD y BDD.

Snowflake.

Experiencia en Servicios Financieros y conocimiento de datos.

Experiencia trabajando con Aladdin.

¿Qué te ofrecemos?

23 días laborables de vacaciones y el 24 y 31 de diciembre.
Numerosos beneficios sociales (seguro médico, ayuda al teletrabajo, seguro de vida y seguro de accidentes).
Programa de Retribución Flexible (tarjeta comida, cheques guardería, tarjeta transporte, clases de inglés online, seguro médico para tu familia…).
Acceso gratuito a varias plataformas de formación.
Estabilidad y carrera profesional.
Tenemos implantado un plan de compensación de referencias internas.
Posibilidad de elección de percibir tu salario en 12 o 14 pagas.
Medidas de conciliación (horario flexible, teletrabajo, asesoramiento de especialistas (psicólogo, nutricionista, entrenador personal), jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano según proyecto).
Plataforma UST Club descuentos y descuentos en gimnasios.

Si quieres conocer más, no dudes en inscribirte y nos pondremos en contacto contigo para ampliarte información de la posición ¡Te estamos esperando!

Title: Data Engineer_Automobilbranche (w/m/d) - bundesweit remote
text:
Für den Data Fachbereich von einem namhaften Enterprise-Kunden suchen wir bundesweit:

Cloud Data Engineer (All genders)

Anforderungen

Fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Data Engineering und/oder Data Analytics
Fundierte Erfahurng in der Programmierung mit Python und SQL
Cloud-Affinität: gutes Knowhow in gängigen Public Cloud oder das Interesse sich in Cloud einzuarbeiten
Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und fließendes Englisch

Nice To Have

Erste Erfahrung mit CI/CD Pipelines
Relevante Zertifikate oder die Bereitschaft sie abzuschließen
Erfahrung in der Datenvisualisierung und Kommunikation mit Stakeholdern

Worum Es Geht

Das Unternehmen ist einer der führenden IT-Dienstleister im deutschsprachigen Raum. Es unterstützt Kunden aus verschiedenen Branchen bei der Digitalen Transformation, vor allem in Themenfeldern wie AI& Data Analytics, Cloud & Migration, IoT und Software Development. Der Fachbereich Big Data besteht aus 150 Mitarbeitenden und ist verantwortlich für die Umsetzung komplexer Data & Analytics Enterprise-Projekte.

Als (Senior) Data Engineer bist du dafür zuständig:

Erarbeitung von Use Cases für Kunden aus unterschiedlichen Industrien
Umsetzung von Projekten mit Azure/AWS Toolstack und der dabei integrierten Analysesoftware
Implementierung von Data Pipelines im Rahmen von Produktentwicklungen oder Kundenprojekten
Konzeption, technische Architektur und Umsetzung von Cloud-Lösungen: End-to-End von der Ideenfindung über den Proof of Concept bis zur Produktion und kontinuierlichen Verbesserung
Unterstützung des Vertriebs bei Kundenterminen und Anforderungsanalyse
Du entwickelst dich stets technisch und professionell weiter und fördert das Wissen im Team

Dafür Wird Ihnen Geboten

30 Tage Urlaubstage
Agiles modernes Arbeitsumfeld: Remote-Kultur, wenig Reiseanteil
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice Möglichkeiten
Tarifvertrag, reines Fixgehalt und dazu noch betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Eine große Anzahl von Weiterbildungs- und Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Bereitstellung von Arbeitszeit und weiterer Ressourcen für Schulungen und Zertifikate
Große langfristige Projekte im Enterprise-Umfeld, vor allem mit Fokus auf Automobilbranche
Teamarbeit bei Kundenprojekten statt Ein-Mann-Armee
Agile Projektarbeit nach Scrum-Ansatz
Unterschiedliche Möglichkeiten, deine Karriere mitzugestalten
Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche und umfangreiches Mentoring

Hiring Prozess

Bewerbung - Erster Austausch mit mir/Han - 2 IVs mit dem Unternehmen/Fachbereich - Angebot/Absage

Bei Rückfragen steht Han CHANG (she/her, Mail: h.chang@frankgroup.com) gerne zur Verfügung.

Impressum - https://www.frankgroup.com/de/impressum/

Title: Data Engineer (India based)
text:
Keenfolks is a global Integrative A.I. Agency that connects Business, Marketing & Prop Technology to deliver efficiency and growth to Fortune 500 companies. We work with Merck Pharmaceutical, Coca-Cola, Johnson & Johnson, Reckitt, Danone, Nestle, Kellogg's, Royal Canine, Femsa & more brands in more than 40 markets worldwide.




Our vision is to become the leader in INTEGRATIVE A. I empower multinationals to grow efficiency and sales.




Our mission is to fuel GREATNESS to companies, individuals, and society through Human Centric A.I. Transformation.




So, what do we do exactly?




We create AI-first end-to-end global and local programs to help multinationals create new revenue business models, implement edge innovation, design experience, create tech strategy, lead business & digital transformation, implement Web 3 Strategy, accelerate sales and automation. You can learn more about our service on our website.




Role




Be-self driven, work under uncertainty and loves learning and self-improvement!




Designing, implementing, and maintaining automated ETL pipelines with Python in cloud environments (Azure, AWS, GCP).




Support the team on EDA and data science related tasks.




Work with the development team in building end-to-end digital products with data & AI components.




Support the team to adhere to software development/coding best practices.




Evaluate, test and work with APIs to extract and harmonize data from different sources.




Qualifications




Loves programming in Python and has at least 4 years of experience with it.




Experience building, maintaining data pipelines in Cloud environments and working with API’s is a must.




Good knowledge of SQL, data modeling, relational databases and experience with Spark are valued.




Knowledge of Azure, Databricks and Data Factory are highly valued.




Experience applying advanced analytics to design, develop, implement, and deploy data-driven products.




Experience working with version control software, Github and CI/CD.




Loves self-learning, teaching, and interacting with a highly motivated team in a great multinational environment.




Fluent in English.




Perks




Dynamic, young and international environment with +26 nationalities in our Barcelona office!




Competitive salary and benefits package.




Fun and creative work environment.




Work from home flexibility (2 days at the office)




Lunch, coffee and snacks at the office




Short Fridays




Regular team outings and social events.




Bike annual allowance




An entrepreneurial environment that encourages continuous innovation




Company culture built on passion, trust and constructive freedom




Career development and continuous opportunities to grow 🚀




Your Attitude




We believe in pushing our boundaries, we believe that innovation requires vulnerability and so, we take calculated risks. Here at Keenfolks, we're constantly in search of greatness and never settle for just being good. We recognise and reward those that consider themselves to be change-makers and experimental in their approach, therefore, we're keen to connect with innovators…someone that takes the learning in each experience, coupled with them having an entrepreneurial mindset.




Diversity Matters




Keenfolks is an equal employer. It is the policy of Keenfolks to give equal opportunities in career and development regardless of gender identity, gender reassignment, sexual identity, sexual orientation, marital status, race, ethnic origin, age, political view, religion, disability, pregnancy, maternity, and paternity. We believe in true equality for all, and so, through our culture, corporate social responsibility, and day to day activities, we hope and strive to have a positive impact on today's society.




WANT TO KNOW MORE?




Follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram @the_keenfolks to learn more about our culture & values!

Title: Data Engineer up to 6000 BGN net Remote
text:
Data Engineer function will be focused on the collecting, storing, processing and preparing datasets for analyzing world class products – features adoption, client’s acquisition and behavior, customers lifetime value etc. And on the other side, be part of the team developing analytics as a product, which is reaching one of the biggest operators in the industry.

You will oversee the ingestion, transformation, delivery, and movement of data throughout every part of an organization. The primary focus will be on choosing optimal solutions to use for these purposes, then maintaining, implementing, and monitoring them. You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company.

With whom you will work?

The day-to-day interactions are mainly with the product and analytics/ BI team members, working on improvement and expansion of our data models.
In maintaining and optimizing our data infrastructure will be in touch with the DevOps and DBA teams.
When have to include new data in the data models and/or reflect the latest platform changes, you will be working with the dev engineering teams.

Tools you will use on a daily bases

Databases - PostgreSQL and Oracle
Programming languages – SQL / Python / Scala / Java
Computing frameworks - Apache Spark / Kafka / Hadoop and Hadoop YARN

Responsibilities

You will develop and maintain the different data pipelines in order to ensure the quality and accuracy of our product analytics, as well as build datasets for reports and visualizations for internal use and external customers.
Explore and implement data and technology best practices, guidelines, and repeatable processes in building pipelines, logical data models and pre-aggregated analytics data sets
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of large volumes of data from a wide variety of data sources - both internal and external
Proactively identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Develop ETL monitoring and testing in order to troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, ensuring data quality and availability
You will provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior members of the data engineering team.

About You

At least 3 years of experience in Dev engineering role
Experience with feature engineering and data pipelines using Python, SQL, Scala and similar programming language
Strong knowledge of distributed computing frameworks, likeApache Spark, Hadoop and Hadoop YARN, for managing and processing big data sets
Experience in data acquisition (API calls/FTP downloads), ETL, transformation / normalization (from raw to DB table schema structure), storage (Raw files, Database server), distribution & access (Entitlements for users, build of API’s and access points for data)
Solid knowledge of data warehousing platforms like Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, Oracle, including data transformation (DBT, Talend), data model design and query optimization strategies
Experience in data management – clean and commented code, version control, documentation, automated testing and deployment etc.
Familiar with the design (dimensional modeling and schema design) and optimization of databases or data warehouses - including handling and logging errors, system monitoring
Experience with event-driven technologies and streaming such as RMQ and/or Kafka

Title: Data Engineer - Fully Remote
text:
Data Engineer

Fully remote

Salary up to €80,000 + benefits

Leading Data-Driven Company

A leading data-driven company is seeking a talented and passionate Data Engineer to join their exceptional team of innovators. This renowned organization pioneers the utilization of data to drive meaningful insights and revolutionize industries. They believe in the untapped possibilities hidden within every data point and are committed to uncovering its true value. With cutting-edge technologies and a diverse team of innovators, they are at the forefront of the data revolution.

Role And Responsibilities

The Data Engineer will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing robust data pipelines, ensuring seamless data integration, and optimizing data storage and retrieval systems. Their expertise will be crucial in driving the scalability and performance of the company's data infrastructure, empowering clients to make data-driven decisions with confidence. Responsibilities include:

Designing and developing efficient and scalable data pipelines.
Ensuring data quality, integrity, and security throughout the data lifecycle.
Implementing advanced data processing algorithms to derive valuable insights.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide innovative solutions.
Optimizing data storage and retrieval systems for performance and scalability.
Monitoring and troubleshooting data-related issues to ensure smooth operations.
Staying updated with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies in data engineering.

Qualifications And Skills

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or similar role, with a strong understanding of data engineering concepts and best practices.
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or Scala.
Hands-on experience with big data processing frameworks such as Hadoop, Spark, or Apache Beam.
Expertise in designing and implementing data warehouses, data lakes, and ETL/ELT processes.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

How To Apply

If you are passionate about the power of data and want to make a significant impact, apply now to join this leading data-driven company as a Data Engineer. Please submit your resume, highlighting your relevant experience and qualifications,

Title: Data Engineer in der Unternehmensberatung
text:
Als Data Engineer bist Du zentral für den Produkterfolg. Ein Grundstein dafür sind die Skalierbarkeit und die Sicherheit unserer Analyseplattform.




Unsere selbstentwickelte Analyseplattform premergency bietet folgende Funktionen:




Verschiedene Backend Services
Eigene Routing engine und Risiko-Algorithmen in skalierbarer Worker-Architektur




Im Bereich Consulting arbeiten wir mit namhaften Kunden aus Handel, Chemie, Manufacturing und Public Security an geobasierten Datenarchitekturen und Innovationsprojekten.




Aufgaben




Weiterentwicklung unserer Softwarearchitektur und Cloudplattform im Software-Team
Weiterentwicklung unserer Backend-Services
Ableitung von Tools aus den Beratungsprojekten für Wiederverwendbarkeit und Skalierung
Datenaufbereitung in unseren Beratungsprojekten (Big Data Management)




Qualifikation




Master in Mathematik, Informatik, Physik oder einer verwandten Disziplin mit Software-Fokus.
gute Erfahrung in Softwarearchitektur - Du solltest relevante Autoren und Gestaltungsmuster kennen,
Gute Kenntnisse des Spring Framework (v5), zusätzliches Interesse an neuen Technologien wie GoLang
Grundkenntnisse in Python und Bereitschaft Pipelines, Worker, etc. in Python statt Java zu schreiben, auch wenn Java in unserem Backend Stack vorherrscht.
Gute Kenntnisse in mindestens einem ETL oder Tool zur Datenverarbeitung (e.g. Apache Airflow, Apache Beam, Spring Dataflow, Kedro)
Begeisterung und Kenntnisse von Docker / Kubernetes oder sich in diese reinzuarbeiten
Gute Fertigkeiten in SQL-2011 und Erfahrungen in PostgreSQL
Kenntnisse von MPP Datenbanken wie Spark 2.0 oder Exasol runden Dein Profil ab
Kenntnisse in Scrum und User Stories sind willkommen (ACs, Task-breakdown etc.),
Bereitschaft eine Prüfung zur Zertifizierung als Google Professional Cloud Data Engineer in der Probezeit zu absolvieren
Wir erwarten, dass Du fließend Englisch sprichst (UniCert C1 or C2)
Bereitschaft an Beratungsprojekten mitzuarbeiten und zupackend zu arbeiten




Benefits




überdurchschnittliche Vergütung
natürlich Hardware fürs Home Office
Förderung von Women in Tech und Women Techmakers,
kostenlose, warme und kalte Getränke,
Obstkorb & Snacks für den Vitaminhaushalt,
monatlicher Gutschein fürs Fitnessstudio oder Sportverein,
lernende Organisation - kostenlose Fortbildungskurse von Coursera und eigene Fachbibliothek aber auch externe Fortbildungen,
Jobticket oder Tiefgaragenstellplatz auf Wunsch,
Firmenfahrrad für Pendler auf Wunsch,
vermögenswirksame Leistungen des Arbeitgebers.




Arbeitsatmosphäre




spannende Kunden und Projekte
flexible Arbeitszeiten und -konten
eigene Produktentwicklung aus Big Data und Algorithmik
lockere Arbeitsatmosphäre in einem jungen, innovativen aber sehr erfahrenen Team
sehr erfahrenes Team




Arbeitsplatz




300m von der Stadtbahnhaltestelle Hürth-Efferen entfernt, Bushaltestelle direkt vor der Tür; 20min zum Flughafen, 20min zum ICE-Bahnhof
voll Remote-fähig
neuester Laptop, 27″ Displays
Ergonomischer Arbeitsplatz mit höhenverstellbarem Schreibtisch und Tageslichtlampen
sonnendurchflutete Büros (im Sommer Klimatisierung und Verschattung)

Wir freuen uns Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Data Engineer_Automobilbranche (w/m/d) - bundesweit remote
text:
Für den Data Fachbereich von einem namhaften Enterprise-Kunden suchen wir bundesweit:




Cloud Data Engineer (All genders)




Anforderungen:




Fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Data Engineering und/oder Data Analytics
Fundierte Erfahurng in der Programmierung mit Python und SQL
Cloud-Affinität: gutes Knowhow in gängigen Public Cloud oder das Interesse sich in Cloud einzuarbeiten
Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und fließendes Englisch




Nice to have:




Erste Erfahrung mit CI/CD Pipelines
Relevante Zertifikate oder die Bereitschaft sie abzuschließen
Erfahrung in der Datenvisualisierung und Kommunikation mit Stakeholdern




Worum es geht:




Das Unternehmen ist einer der führenden IT-Dienstleister im deutschsprachigen Raum. Es unterstützt Kunden aus verschiedenen Branchen bei der Digitalen Transformation, vor allem in Themenfeldern wie AI& Data Analytics, Cloud & Migration, IoT und Software Development. Der Fachbereich Big Data besteht aus 150 Mitarbeitenden und ist verantwortlich für die Umsetzung komplexer Data & Analytics Enterprise-Projekte.




Als (Senior) Data Engineer bist du dafür zuständig:




Erarbeitung von Use Cases für Kunden aus unterschiedlichen Industrien
Umsetzung von Projekten mit Azure/AWS Toolstack und der dabei integrierten Analysesoftware
Implementierung von Data Pipelines im Rahmen von Produktentwicklungen oder Kundenprojekten
Konzeption, technische Architektur und Umsetzung von Cloud-Lösungen: End-to-End von der Ideenfindung über den Proof of Concept bis zur Produktion und kontinuierlichen Verbesserung
Unterstützung des Vertriebs bei Kundenterminen und Anforderungsanalyse
Du entwickelst dich stets technisch und professionell weiter und fördert das Wissen im Team




Dafür wird Ihnen geboten:




30 Tage Urlaubstage
Agiles modernes Arbeitsumfeld: Remote-Kultur, wenig Reiseanteil
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice Möglichkeiten
Tarifvertrag, reines Fixgehalt und dazu noch betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Eine große Anzahl von Weiterbildungs- und Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Bereitstellung von Arbeitszeit und weiterer Ressourcen für Schulungen und Zertifikate
Große langfristige Projekte im Enterprise-Umfeld, vor allem mit Fokus auf Automobilbranche
Teamarbeit bei Kundenprojekten statt Ein-Mann-Armee
Agile Projektarbeit nach Scrum-Ansatz
Unterschiedliche Möglichkeiten, deine Karriere mitzugestalten
Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche und umfangreiches Mentoring




Hiring Prozess:




Bewerbung - Erster Austausch mit mir/Han - 2 IVs mit dem Unternehmen/Fachbereich - Angebot/Absage




Bei Rückfragen steht Han CHANG (she/her, Mail: h.chang@frankgroup.com) gerne zur Verfügung.




Impressum - https://www.frankgroup.com/de/impressum/

Title: Data Infrastructure Engineer
text:
You'll be instrumental in building data ingestion strategies that scale and stay rock-solid. Imagine working with a mix of traditional batch ETL, CDC, and event-based methods – it's going to be thrilling!

Your expertise in infrastructure-as-code, continuous integration, and automated deployment will be a game-changer. We're super thrilled about your ability to ensure top-notch observability.

Guess what? We're all about that DevOps mindset, and we know you'll bring some serious value to our team with your expertise in that area.

Performance is the name of the game, and your database and data warehouse know-how will help us optimize those queries for amazing results.

We're on the lookout for someone who loves tackling challenges head-on, solving those tricky problems, and constantly elevating our analytics platform.

Calling all those with Microsoft Azure skills! If you've got over 3 years of experience with Azure data and analytics services like Synapse Analytics, SQL Managed Instance, Databricks, Event Hub, Data Factory, and Log Analytics – you're exactly who we need!

But that's not all – we're also interested in your experience with container and orchestration tools like Kubernetes, Docker, and Podman. Plus, if you've worked with orchestration systems like Apache Airflow, that's a major plus in our book!

And hey, we're all about embracing the infrastructure-as-code approach. So if you're well-versed in tools like Terraform, ARM, Cloudformation, or similar, you're someone who should apply.

If this sounds like the perfect fit for you, let's connect! We can't wait to hear more about your impressive experience and see how you'll make a big impact on our team!

Recognized twice by the Financial Times as Africa's fastest growing company (2022 and 2023) and by Time as one of the most influential companies this year, we've served over 5 million customers, unlocking $1 billion in cumulative credit for the unbanked across Africa.

At M-KOPA, we empower our people to own their careers through diverse development programs, coaching partnerships, and on-the-job training. We support individual journeys with family-friendly policies, prioritize well-being, and embrace flexibility. Join us in shaping the future of M-KOPA as we grow together. Explore more at m-kopa.com.

BENEFITS, WHAT'S IN FOR YOU:

Private health insurance (inpatient outpatient, parental time off, eye care, and dental)
Life insurance (2 x gross salary)
Company pension
Remote working /
25 days leave per annum (excludes additional 8 public bank holidays)
Annual Learning and Development Fund - You have an annual $ 1,200 allowance to spend on learning and development (that is, between 1 January and 31 December). For your first year at M-KOPA, this allowance is pro-rated depending on the month that you start.
Home Office Set Up - Having the best IT equipment tools in the world doesn't make sense if you do not have a proper setup to work with. For this reason, M-KOPA will pre-approve the following items for a total budget of $1000 that you can use at any time after signing the offer letter with M-KOPA
On site retreats with wider tech team, plus trips to operational markets


M-KOPA is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to assembling a diverse, broadly trained staff. Women, minorities, and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.

M-KOPA explicitly prohibits the use of Forced or Child Labour and respects the rights of its employees to agree to terms and conditions of employment voluntarily, without coercion, and freely terminate their employment on appropriate notice. M-KOPA shall ensure that its Employees are of legal working age and shall comply with local laws for youth employment or student work, such as internships or apprenticeships.

M-KOPA does not collect/charge any money as a pre-employment or post-employment requirement. This means that we never ask for ‘recruitment fees’, ‘processing fees’, ‘interview fees’, or any other kind of money in exchange for offer letters or interviews at any time during the hiring process.

Title: (Junior) Consultant Data Engineer Automotive (m/w/d)
text:
Das erwartet Dich als [mover & shaper]




Du entwickelst komplexe Automotive Analytics Applications weiter
Du analysierst und modellierst Daten, konzipierst Datenflüsse und entwickelst Lösungen, die auf der Basis belastbarer Datenqualität unseren Kunden zu ihren wettbewerbsdifferenzierenden Entscheidungen verhelfen
Als Teil eines erfahrenen Teams unterstützt Du bereits ab Anforderungserhebung sowie beim Management, Design und bei Umsetzung, Einführung und Betrieb verlässlicher Business Intelligence (BI) und Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDWH) Lösungen
Schwerpunkt Deiner täglichen Arbeit ist die Integration unterschiedlichster Daten durch bewährte Datenversorgungsmethoden wie ETL oder ELT, Datenmodellierung nach Data Vault, Snowflake oder Star Schemata und die erkenntnisgewinnende Visualisierung dieser
Du bringst Dich in unserer unternehmensweiten Analytics-Community (z. B. Graduate-Ausbildung, Demo-Systeme, Kompetenzentwicklung und interner Wissensaustausch) ein


Das macht Dich zum [mover & shaper]




Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, -Mathematik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Du hast erste Erfahrungen in der Konzeption und Umsetzung von Data- & Analytics-Lösungen
Du konntest erste Erfahrungen im Umgang mit der Abfragesprache SQL sowie der Umsetzung von Datenversorgungen via ETL und / oder ELT sammeln.
Du hast erste Kenntnisse in ETL-Tools wie Informatica PowerCenter, MS Integration Services oder idealerweise SAP BO Data Services
Idealerweise bringst Du Know-how im Bereich Requirements Engineering und / oder Datenvisualisierung (z.B. in MS Power BI oder SAC) mit
Ein überzeugendes Auftreten sowie eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise sind für Dich selbstverständlich
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Beratung heißt Flexibilität: Dein Projekteinsatz richtet sich nach unseren Kunden und Deiner Projektsituation und beinhaltet sowohl hybrides Arbeiten als auch den Einsatz vor Ort


Das bieten wir [movers & shapers]




Weiterbildung: umfangreiche fachliche und methodische Trainings inkl. Zertifizierungen sowie vielfältige Entwicklungsperspektiven innerhalb des Unternehmens
Work-Life-Balance: Arbeitszeitkonto, hybrides und ortsflexibles Arbeiten innerhalb von Deutschland und bis zu 21 Tage pro Jahr in definierten EU-Ländern, Familienservice, Firmenfitness sowie die Möglichkeit zu einem Sabbatical
Flexible Urlaubsgestaltung: 30 Tage Urlaub und die Möglichkeit zur individuellen Erhöhung oder Verringerung des jährlichen Urlaubs um bis zu 5 Tage
IT-Equipment: Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Ausstattung von benötigtem Zusatz-Equipment für ein optimales ortsflexibles Arbeiten
Selbst fahren: Firmenwagen und Dienstfahrrad per Gehaltsumwandlung
Unser Beitrag: konzernweites Stipendienprogramm für junge Menschen in Indien und viele weitere Corporate-Responsibility-Projekte in den Bereichen Bildung, Beschäftigung und digitale Inklusion
Unser Mindset: Teamspirit, offene Türen, Duzkultur, gelebte Vielfalt

Title: Consultant Data Engineer Azure H/F
text:
Adapt-RH, Facilitateur d'Emploi et de Recrutement, nous accompagnons les Entreprises de tous les secteurs d'activités dans le process recrutement de leurs futurs Talents en CDD et CDI. Notre coeur de métier est de fédérer une communauté de Talents, de les rendre attractifs et réceptifs à ces offres d'emploi.

Process recrutement : Nous nous engageons !

-> 100% des candidatures reçoivent une réponse sous 7 jours.
Pré sélection et entretien téléphonique sous 48h
Après validation du futur employeur, entretien visio avec votre consultant
Après accord du candidat et du futur employeur, entretien final en présentiel sous 7 jours

Expert et autonome sur les plateformes de données Microsoft Azure ?

Envie d'être entrepreneur tout en gardant les avantages d'un statut de salarié ?

Et si la CAE-SCOP était la solution ?

Au sein d'une société coopérative et participative spécialisée dans les services du numérique, vous aurez l'opportunité de travailler et d'entreprendre au sein d'un collectif d'experts, en mutualisant l'administratif et en récoltant le fruit de votre travail !

Dans le souhait de poursuivre sa croissance, nous recherchons un consultant Data Engineer Azure F/H.

En charge de la conception, l'implémentation et la maintenance de solutions d'analyse de données, vos missions seront :

Accompagner et conseiller des clients dans leur adoption des plateformes de données modernes avec Microsoft Azure et Power BI (étude, proposition d'architectures, audit, DEVOPS, FinOps)
Concevoir, mettre en oeuvre et optimiser des solutions d'analyse de données (datawarehouses, data lakes, pipelines, models, reportings) à l'état de l'art
Fournir une expertise technique approfondie aux équipes data pour répondre à leurs enjeux et problématiques de façon proactive
Établir des relations de confiance avec les décisionnaires techniques et métiers afin de favoriser la réussite des projets et la création de valeur
Assister et former les clients aux usages et outils d'Azure et de Power BI
Réaliser une veille technologique permanente sur les produits et tendances du marché

Salaire selon expérience

De formation Bac +2 à Bac +5 dans le domaine de l'informatique, vous justifiez d'une expertise reconnue et d'une expérience significative sur les plateformes de données Microsoft AZURE.

Vous possédez une compréhension approfondie des technologies cloud et maitriser les services suivants : Azure Synapse Analytics, Data Factory, Databricks, SQL Database, DEVOPS, Analysis Services, Power BI

Faisant preuve d'initiative, votre esprit collaboratif et solidaire est un indicateur que l'entrepreneuriat en CAE est fait pour vous !

Autonome, vous avez un portefeuille client et êtes capable d'apporter des solutions sur des missions d'expertise ponctuelles, comme sur des missions au long cours.

Votre aisance dans la communication orale et écrite et un esprit fort d'analyse feront de vous un acteur incontournable auprès de nos clients et de la CAE.

Title: Data Engineer Utrecht Dutch No Visa No Relocation Max 64K
text:
Do you agree that the foundation of a future-proof data platform is for your client to be capable of managing the data?




Much can be said about data management, but let's start with data quality, data ownership, and data lineage. Our client believes that you can't deliver honest, usable reports if your data quality isn't up to standard and it's not clear who bears responsibility for it.




Do you find it challenging to work with colleagues from this philosophy to develop a structured (Azure) data platform and build reports based on the customer's needs?




A data engineer stands out with knowledge and/or experience in:




Project Teams:





Willing to work together in small project teams and tackle complex issues in a structured way to come up with future-proof solutions.




Communication:





You naturally have an open approach to communication. You remain receptive, ensuring you ask questions until you fully understand.




Technical:





You are passionate about transforming data into information. You do this based on the latest insights in an Azure environment.




Data modeling is a familiar domain for you. You have an interest and/or experience in both front-end and back-end development of a data platform.

Title: AWS Data Engineer – offshore (UE)
text:
Capstone Integrated Solutions is a comprehensive services provider. Our team consists of outstanding professionals, highly experienced in designing, building, and supporting retail software. We see ourselves as a build-as-a-service provider who follows a repeatable business pattern that can be applied to a variety of platforms and verticals. Having a culture built on outcomes and delivery at the core of the business, Capstone is providing its customers with a complete suite of services for software development, system analysis, integration, implementation, and support, as well as the option to engage a single team to perform all the services they require.




Who You Are and What You'll Do:




Capstone Integrated Solutions is looking for an AWS Data Engineer. You will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable and efficient data lake solutions using Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud services. You will leverage your expertise in data architecture, AWS technologies, and big data frameworks to enable organizations to store, process, and analyze large volumes of data for business insights and decision-making.




Responsibilities:




Architectural Design: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and define the data lake architecture strategy. Design and implement scalable and cost-effective data lake solutions using AWS services such as Amazon S3, AWS Glue, AWS Lake Formation, AWS Athena, AWS EMR, and others.
Data Ingestion and Integration: Define and implement data ingestion strategies to efficiently capture data from various sources, both batch and real-time. Design and implement data integration workflows and pipelines to process, transform, and load data into the data lake using tools such as AWS Glue, AWS Data Pipeline, or custom ETL/ELT processes.
Data Governance and Security: Define and enforce data governance practices to ensure data quality, integrity, and compliance. Implement security controls and access policies to protect sensitive data within the data lake. Establish and monitor data cataloging and metadata management processes to enable data discovery and lineage tracking.
Data Lake Optimization: Optimize data lake performance and cost efficiency through partitioning, indexing, compression, and other techniques. Implement data lake partitioning strategies to enable efficient querying and analysis of large datasets. Monitor data lake usage and performance metrics to identify bottlenecks and propose optimizations.
Data Analytics and Visualization: Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and business stakeholders to define analytics and reporting requirements. Design and implement data lake architectures that support various analytics frameworks, such as AWS Glue, Amazon Redshift, AWS Athena, Apache Spark, or custom analytics solutions. Enable data visualization and reporting using tools like AWS QuickSight, Tableau, or others.
Scalability and Availability: Design data lake architectures that can scale horizontally and vertically to handle growing data volumes and user demands. Implement fault-tolerant and highly available data lake solutions using AWS services such as Amazon S3 cross-region replication, data backups, and disaster recovery strategies.
Documentation and Collaboration: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation, including architectural diagrams, data flow diagrams, and operational procedures. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders, to ensure alignment and effective implementation of the data lake architecture.




"Must Haves"- Experience you need to succeed:




Extensive experience in designing and implementing data lake solutions on AWS cloud.
Strong understanding of data lake concepts, data modeling, and data architecture principles.
In-depth knowledge of AWS services related to data lakes, such as Amazon S3, AWS Glue, AWS Lake Formation, AWS Athena, AWS EMR, etc.
Proficiency in big data technologies and frameworks, such as Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, or others.
Experience with data ingestion and integration techniques, including batch and real-time data ingestion, ETL/ELT processes, and data integration patterns.
Familiarity with data governance and data security practices in a cloud environment.
Ability to optimize data lake performance and cost efficiency through partitioning, indexing, compression, and other optimization techniques.
Strong knowledge of data analytics and visualization tools, such as AWS QuickSight, Tableau, or others.
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, with the ability to analyze complex data issues and propose effective solutions.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work with diverse stakeholders and present technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
AWS certifications such as AWS Certified Big Data - Specialty or AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate/Professional are highly desirable.




"Our Culture":




At Capstone, the central principles that we all adhere to, and the glue that holds us together, are our keystones. Our four keystones are:




"A Customer Obsessed, Delivery Focused, Culture"
We're driven to exceed our customer's expectations by listening, leading, solving problems, and delivering what we promise
We aim to be the most dependable and trusted partner serving our customers. TRUST = CONSISTENCY x TIME
"A Culture of Learning and Sharing"
We value "Lifetime Learners"; those who are hungry, competitive, curious, and self-motivated in their pursuit of knowledge.
Personal and professional growth depends on teamwork and continuous learning. By sharing knowledge, skills, ideas, and effort, we benefit our customers, ourselves, and our communities.
We recognize that the thoughts, feelings, and backgrounds of others are as important as our own. Everyone has something to learn and everyone has something they can teach.
Knowledge and ability are valued. Sharing knowledge and helping others learn new capabilities is valued exponentially.
"A Culture of Growth and Scalability"
Growth comes from not establishing barriers in your role. "Cross functional skill sets are valued and help us deliver to our customers in a truly agile fashion. It comes with understanding that when asked to do something new, you will need support, have questions, and make some mistakes along the way.
The most elegant solution is a simple solution. Simple doesn't mean easy. It's often more difficult to break a complex problem down into simple, scalable terms. We don't appreciate, or value, over architected solutions or superfluous coding.
Time is one of our most precious commodities. Scalability implies being respectful of this and passionate about making the most efficient use of each and every one of our team members time.
"All Work is Strategic"
No matter how small a project or assignment appears, every single engagement is an opportunity for us to prove ourselves, build trust, and develop relationships that last and grow
Every task, interaction, and commitment matters
Big or small, we execute our plans and strategies with focus, commitment, and passion




We offer:




Job Type: Full-time Remote Job




B2B Contract in EU




Direct contract with an American company!

Title: Werksstudent:in Data Engineer (initiativ)
text:
Dies ist eine INITIATIVBEWERBUNG! Bewirb dich jetzt über talentbase .tech ...




und wähle bis zu 35 Partner-Unternehmen aus, an welche wir dein Profil für eine DATA ENGINEER Stelle weiterleiten.

Datenextraktion, Transformation und Laden (ETL) von verschiedenen Datenquellen.
Unterstützung bei der Entwicklung und Pflege von Datenpipelines.
Datenspeicherung und -verwaltung in Datenbanken oder Data Warehouses.
Mitarbeit bei der Datentransformation und -bereinigung.
Überwachung und Wartung von Datenverarbeitungsprozessen.





Qualifikation




Programmierkenntnisse in Sprachen wie Python, Java oder Scala
Verständnis der grundlegenden Datenbankkonzepte und -technologien
Erfahrung mit Big-Data-Frameworks wie Hadoop oder Spark
Kenntnisse in der Datenmodellierung und ETL-Prozessen
Vertrautheit mit SQL und grundlegendes Verständnis von NoSQL-Datenbanken
Problemlösungsfähigkeiten und analytisches Denkvermögen
Teamfähigkeit und die Fähigkeit, effektiv in einem dynamischen Umfeld zu arbeiten
Aufmerksamkeit für Detail und Genauigkeit bei der Datenverarbeitung
Grundlegende Kenntnisse in der Arbeit mit Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS, GCP oder Azure

Title: Data Infrastructure Engineer
text:
You'll be instrumental in building data ingestion strategies that scale and stay rock-solid. Imagine working with a mix of traditional batch ETL, CDC, and event-based methods – it's going to be thrilling!

Your expertise in infrastructure-as-code, continuous integration, and automated deployment will be a game-changer. We're super thrilled about your ability to ensure top-notch observability.

Guess what? We're all about that DevOps mindset, and we know you'll bring some serious value to our team with your expertise in that area.

Performance is the name of the game, and your database and data warehouse know-how will help us optimize those queries for amazing results.

We're on the lookout for someone who loves tackling challenges head-on, solving those tricky problems, and constantly elevating our analytics platform.

Calling all those with Microsoft Azure skills! If you've got over 3 years of experience with Azure data and analytics services like Synapse Analytics, SQL Managed Instance, Databricks, Event Hub, Data Factory, and Log Analytics – you're exactly who we need!

But that's not all – we're also interested in your experience with container and orchestration tools like Kubernetes, Docker, and Podman. Plus, if you've worked with orchestration systems like Apache Airflow, that's a major plus in our book!

And hey, we're all about embracing the infrastructure-as-code approach. So if you're well-versed in tools like Terraform, ARM, Cloudformation, or similar, you're someone who should apply.

If this sounds like the perfect fit for you, let's connect! We can't wait to hear more about your impressive experience and see how you'll make a big impact on our team!

Recognized twice by the Financial Times as Africa's fastest growing company (2022 and 2023) and by Time as one of the most influential companies this year, we've served over 5 million customers, unlocking $1 billion in cumulative credit for the unbanked across Africa.

At M-KOPA, we empower our people to own their careers through diverse development programs, coaching partnerships, and on-the-job training. We support individual journeys with family-friendly policies, prioritize well-being, and embrace flexibility. Join us in shaping the future of M-KOPA as we grow together. Explore more at m-kopa.com.

BENEFITS, WHAT'S IN FOR YOU:

Private health insurance (inpatient outpatient, parental time off, eye care, and dental)
Life insurance (2 x gross salary)
Company pension
Remote working /
25 days leave per annum (excludes additional 8 public bank holidays)
Annual Learning and Development Fund - You have an annual $ 1,200 allowance to spend on learning and development (that is, between 1 January and 31 December). For your first year at M-KOPA, this allowance is pro-rated depending on the month that you start.
Home Office Set Up - Having the best IT equipment tools in the world doesn't make sense if you do not have a proper setup to work with. For this reason, M-KOPA will pre-approve the following items for a total budget of $1000 that you can use at any time after signing the offer letter with M-KOPA
On site retreats with wider tech team, plus trips to operational markets


M-KOPA is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to assembling a diverse, broadly trained staff. Women, minorities, and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.

M-KOPA explicitly prohibits the use of Forced or Child Labour and respects the rights of its employees to agree to terms and conditions of employment voluntarily, without coercion, and freely terminate their employment on appropriate notice. M-KOPA shall ensure that its Employees are of legal working age and shall comply with local laws for youth employment or student work, such as internships or apprenticeships.

M-KOPA does not collect/charge any money as a pre-employment or post-employment requirement. This means that we never ask for ‘recruitment fees’, ‘processing fees’, ‘interview fees’, or any other kind of money in exchange for offer letters or interviews at any time during the hiring process.
