Title: Workplace Analytics Engineer
text:
Bring your people analytics, social science research and data mining/science skills to a unique team seeking to understand, and shape, the future of the digital workplace. We are interested in technology, of course, but we are also interested in the human mission of enabling the world's brightest and hardest working people to live where they want and work from anywhere. Most of our colleagues could move to a tech hub but they choose Canonical because of our mission and our approach to the workplace.




We'd like to understand what really makes a distributed, remote-first workplace work. We think we're pretty good at this (being remote first for almost 20 years), but we know there is a lot still to understand, and the frontier of possibility continues to move outward. We'd like to invest in research, analytics and tooling which raises the bar even further for remote collaboration and organisation.




If we are able to build tools that meaningfully improve our cooperation and our satisfaction, then we intend to share our insights with the world, both as a narrative and as SAAS or open source that helps other companies follow in our footsteps.




The role of a Workplace Analytics Engineer at Canonical




Support analytics and data mining in a cross-disciplinary team of organisational psychologists, web front end engineers, back end engineers and statistics / analytics experts to help us build a new definition for the 21st century digital workplace. Collaborate to figure out what really drives productivity, effectiveness and happiness in a remote-first globally distributed company.




In addition to your existing people analytics work experience, this role will combine your skills in psychology, data analytics and visualisation, to help create a more effective workplace.




Location: This role will be based remotely in the AMER region.




All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job position.




What your day will look like




Utilize advanced data analytics to understand how we hire and how we work (productivity, happiness and effectiveness) across a global, remote first organisation
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Tell the story from the insights through dashboards, visualizations and presentations
Design and conduct research into trends shaping talent science and remote work
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (ex., engineering, information systems, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem supporting our digital workplace




What we are looking for in you




Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
First work experience in People Analytics
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, R, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualization (Looker Studio, Tableau, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesize and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. Title: MLOps Engineer in Digital& | Data Analytics team (freelance)
text:
PwC is a powerful network of over 250.000 people across 158 countries. All committed to deliver quality in Assurance, Tax, Advisory & Technology services. Match your curiosity with continuous opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact.




Our Digital& | Data Analytics department conducts IT projects for a range of sectors, including financial services, healthcare, e-commerce, and cloud computing, all in Poland and internationally.




As part of the global PwC network, we provide services in the full life-span of software production, such as: analysis and development of functional specifications, data analysis in source systems, defining business requirements, design, development, and post-implementation maintenance of IT systems dedicated to support modern business processes, support in UAT end user tests.




As part of the Data Analytics department you will have the opportunity to apply business and technical knowledge in practice with the support of the best experts in a given field.




Your future role:




3+ years of experience working with ML/AI technologies, including practical experience deploying ML models
Solid experience working with Azure, Azure ML, and other Azure cloud services like Data Factory, Azure SQL, Databricks, Synapse
Proficiency in Python and other programming languages commonly used in Data Science would be an advantage
Nice to have: Familiarity with data related Python libraries and frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Numpy, Pandas and Matplotlib
Expert knowledge on deliver scalable, resilient and automated builds in a local and cloud environments using Azure DevOps high-quality data pipelines
Expertise and practical knowledge of infrastructure as code approach (Terraform is preferred)
Proficiency with Docker
Detailed knowledge and experience in working with networking components, protocols and security (e.g. subnets, firewalls, routing, DNS, HTTP, TLS/SSL, etc.)
Basic knowledge on vulnerability scanning using tools like Veracode, QRadar, Qualys or similar
Scripting knowledge to automate day-to-day tasks
Fluent English




Apply if you have:




Independence
“Get things done” attitude
Team-player mindset and good communication skills




Nice to have:




Designing, building, and maintaining MLOps environment primarily on Azure
Deploying ML models into production using Azure ML
Collaborating with data scientists to understand their needs and assist in crafting solutions
Monitoring and optimizing the MLOps infrastructure on Azure
Ensuring that models are accurately tested and monitored for performance using Azure-based tools
Building and setting up new development tools and infrastructure (CI/CD pipeline implementation)
Ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats
Identifying technical problems and developing software updates and ‘fixes’




Your personal data will be processed for recruitment purposes by PwC Advisory spółka z ograniczoną odpowiedzialnością sp.k. or another PwC entity which runs a recruitment process - (list of entities). If you have given separate consent, data will also be processed for other purposes in accordance with the content of the consents granted. Full information about processing your personal data is available in the Privacy Policy.




467139WD

We'd like to understand what really makes a distributed, remote-first workplace work. We think we're pretty good at this (being remote first for almost 20 years), but we know there is a lot still to understand, and the frontier of possibility continues to move outward. We'd like to invest in research, analytics and tooling which raises the bar even further for remote collaboration and organisation.




If we are able to build tools that meaningfully improve our cooperation and our satisfaction, then we intend to share our insights with the world, both as a narrative and as SAAS or open source that helps other companies follow in our footsteps.




The role of a Workplace Analytics Engineer at Canonical




Support analytics and data mining in a cross-disciplinary team of organisational psychologists, web front end engineers, back end engineers and statistics / analytics experts to help us build a new definition for the 21st century digital workplace. Collaborate to figure out what really drives productivity, effectiveness and happiness in a remote-first globally distributed company.




In addition to your existing people analytics work experience, this role will combine your skills in psychology, data analytics and visualisation, to help create a more effective workplace.




Location: This role will be based remotely in the AMER region.




All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job position.




What your day will look like




Utilize advanced data analytics to understand how we hire and how we work (productivity, happiness and effectiveness) across a global, remote first organisation
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Tell the story from the insights through dashboards, visualizations and presentations
Design and conduct research into trends shaping talent science and remote work
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (ex., engineering, information systems, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem supporting our digital workplace




What we are looking for in you




Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
First work experience in People Analytics
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, R, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualization (Looker Studio, Tableau, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesize and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges




What we offer you




Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilization. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.




In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.




🏠 Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!




📚 Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum




💰 Annual compensation review




🏆 Recognition rewards




🏝 Annual holiday leave




👶 Parental Leave




🧑‍💼 Employee Assistance Programme




🧳 Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'




✈️ Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events




About Canonical




Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.




Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.




Canonical is an equal opportunity employer




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Collaborate to figure out what really drives productivity, effectiveness and happiness in a remote-first globally distributed company.




In addition to your existing people analytics work experience, this role will combine your skills in psychology, data analytics and visualisation, to help create a more effective workplace.




Location: This role will be based remotely in the AMER region.




All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job position.




What your day will look like




Utilize advanced data analytics to understand how we hire and how we work (productivity, happiness and effectiveness) across a global, remote first organisation
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Tell the story from the insights through dashboards, visualizations and presentations
Design and conduct research into trends shaping talent science and remote work
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (ex., engineering, information systems, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem supporting our digital workplace




What we are looking for in you




Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
First work experience in People Analytics
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, R, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualization (Looker Studio, Tableau, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesize and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges




What we offer you




Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilization. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.




In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.




🏠 Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!




📚 Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum




💰 Annual compensation review




🏆 Recognition rewards




🏝 Annual holiday leave




👶 Parental Leave




🧑‍💼 Employee Assistance Programme




🧳 Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'




✈️ Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events




About Canonical




Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.




Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.




Canonical is an equal opportunity employer




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Workplace Analytics Engineer
text:
Bring your people analytics, social science research and data mining/science skills to a unique team seeking to understand, and shape, the future of the digital workplace. We are interested in technology, of course, but we are also interested in the human mission of enabling the world's brightest and hardest working people to live where they want and work from anywhere. Most of our colleagues could move to a tech hub but they choose Canonical because of our mission and our approach to the workplace.




We'd like to understand what really makes a distributed, remote-first workplace work. We think we're pretty good at this (being remote first for almost 20 years), but we know there is a lot still to understand, and the frontier of possibility continues to move outward. We'd like to invest in research, analytics and tooling which raises the bar even further for remote collaboration and organisation.




If we are able to build tools that meaningfully improve our cooperation and our satisfaction, then we intend to share our insights with the world, both as a narrative and as SAAS or open source that helps other companies follow in our footsteps.

Title: Workplace Analytics Engineer
text:
Bring your people analytics, social science research and data mining/science skills to a unique team seeking to understand, and shape, the future of the digital workplace. We are interested in technology, of course, but we are also interested in the human mission of enabling the world's brightest and hardest working people to live where they want and work from anywhere. Most of our colleagues could move to a tech hub but they choose Canonical because of our mission and our approach to the workplace.




We'd like to understand what really makes a distributed, remote-first workplace work. We think we're pretty good at this (being remote first for almost 20 years), but we know there is a lot still to understand, and the frontier of possibility continues to move outward. We'd like to invest in research, analytics and tooling which raises the bar even further for remote collaboration and organisation.




If we are able to build tools that meaningfully improve our cooperation and our satisfaction, then we intend to share our insights with the world, both as a narrative and as SAAS or open source that helps other companies follow in our footsteps.




The role of a Workplace Analytics Engineer at Canonical




Support analytics and data mining in a cross-disciplinary team of organisational psychologists, web front end engineers, back end engineers and statistics / analytics experts to help us build a new definition for the 21st century digital workplace. Collaborate to figure out what really drives productivity, effectiveness and happiness in a remote-first globally distributed company.




In addition to your existing people analytics work experience, this role will combine your skills in psychology, data analytics and visualisation, to help create a more effective workplace.




Location: This role will be based remotely in the AMER region.




All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job position.




What your day will look like




Utilize advanced data analytics to understand how we hire and how we work (productivity, happiness and effectiveness) across a global, remote first organisation
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Tell the story from the insights through dashboards, visualizations and presentations
Design and conduct research into trends shaping talent science and remote work
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (ex., engineering, information systems, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem supporting our digital workplace




What we are looking for in you




Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
First work experience in People Analytics
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, R, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualization (Looker Studio, Tableau, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesize and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges

Title: Ingénieur Méthodes and Données (H/F)
text:
Job Description




Methods and Data Engineer




Technip Energies is looking for a Methods and Data Engineer to strengthen its Information Management team. This position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to mega LNG projects and to Energy Transition projects (Carbon Capture, Green Hydrogen, Offshore Wind…) implementing data management work processes and initiating digital twin.




Within the project task force, the Methods and Data Engineer is part of the Digitalization and Information Management Team, in charge of data handover to Construction and Client. His role is to coordinate the set-up of the Engineering Data Warehouse (central database where project technical data are consolidated) as per project specificities and support users.




Responsibilities
Participate to deployment of the standard modules of the Engineering Data Warehouse for the project (Master Tag Index, Master Document Index, Equipment List, Vendor module…) and adapt the configuration as per project needs and specificities.
Understand the needs, together with Information Management Lead and Data Coordinator
Issue functional specifications and if necessary adapt the data model
Liaise with Engineering Data Warehouse administrators to follow up the configuration and test what they deliver
Prepare user documentation (training material, user guide) et train users (if necessary in the different operating centers)
Support users during project life (first level support, additional requests…)
Work very closely with the other members of IM team using the Engineering Data Warehouse to improve their work.


Have a facilitating role :
Detect and understand additional needs from the engineering disciplines
Help them structuring their data (identification, handling, reuse of multiple sets of data from different sources, to obtain an organized data set).
Convert these data and the associated work process into new modules in the Engineering Data Warehouse (functional specification, clarification with developers, follow-up and test, support and training).






Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree with 3+ years of experience
Ability to demonstrate recent and applicable experience in similar (or data related) role (data analyst, data architect, data engineer managing databases and big amount of data…)
Very good understanding of databases. Knowledge of Aveva Engineering would be a plus.
Knowledge of data management processes and systems, in Oil & Gas engineering
Proficiency in Excel, Access, PowerBI.
Fluency in both written and spoken English




Desired Skills And Competencies




You are organized, self-sufficient, self-directed and analytical.




You are passionate, motivated, with good interpersonal skills.




You have communication skills (written and oral) and experience of working with multiple stakeholders in a international context.




You are versatile and like to work on different topics simultaneously.

Title: Workplace Analytics Engineer
text:
Bring your people analytics, social science research and data mining/science skills to a unique team seeking to understand, and shape, the future of the digital workplace. We are interested in technology, of course, but we are also interested in the human mission of enabling the world's brightest and hardest working people to live where they want and work from anywhere. Most of our colleagues could move to a tech hub but they choose Canonical because of our mission and our approach to the workplace.




We'd like to understand what really makes a distributed, remote-first workplace work. We think we're pretty good at this (being remote first for almost 20 years), but we know there is a lot still to understand, and the frontier of possibility continues to move outward. We'd like to invest in research, analytics and tooling which raises the bar even further for remote collaboration and organisation.




If we are able to build tools that meaningfully improve our cooperation and our satisfaction, then we intend to share our insights with the world, both as a narrative and as SAAS or open source that helps other companies follow in our footsteps.




The role of a Workplace Analytics Engineer at Canonical




Support analytics and data mining in a cross-disciplinary team of organisational psychologists, web front end engineers, back end engineers and statistics / analytics experts to help us build a new definition for the 21st century digital workplace. Collaborate to figure out what really drives productivity, effectiveness and happiness in a remote-first globally distributed company.




In addition to your existing people analytics work experience, this role will combine your skills in psychology, data analytics and visualisation, to help create a more effective workplace.




Location: This role will be based remotely in the AMER region.




All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job position.




What your day will look like




Utilize advanced data analytics to understand how we hire and how we work (productivity, happiness and effectiveness) across a global, remote first organisation
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Tell the story from the insights through dashboards, visualizations and presentations
Design and conduct research into trends shaping talent science and remote work
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (ex., engineering, information systems, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem supporting our digital workplace




What we are looking for in you




Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
First work experience in People Analytics
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, R, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualization (Looker Studio, Tableau, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesize and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges




What we offer you




Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilization. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.




In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.




🏠 Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!




📚 Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum




💰 Annual compensation review




🏆 Recognition rewards




🏝 Annual holiday leave

Title: Data Scientist - Application Developer - Remote
text:
At Cytel, we work hard to create successful careers with significant professional growth for our employees, as a result of which they work hard to make Cytel successful. Cytel is a place where talent, experience and integrity come together to advance the state of clinical development.




Lead one or more statistical programming study teams or application development projects. Responsible for project level programming or app development activities.




Major Responsibilities




Provide leadership, guidance, and hands-on support to d evelop data analysis solution for complex business problems in collaboration with biostatisticians and Statistical programmers e.g., R Shiny / Python web application
Ensure technical validity, compliance to standards and SOPs, regulatory requirements
Test, debug and optimize applications to ensure they work as expected, using both manual and automated testing techniques and provide documentation as perComputer System Assurance guidance
Develop and maintain deployment and configuration instructions and ensure performance, security, and scalability of deployed applications
Provide technical support to junior level programmers on day-to-day assigned activities




Required Education/Experience




Bachelor or Master of Science degree or equivalent in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Life Science, or related field.
at least 6 years of programming experience 3+ for R, R Shiny for preferably in processing clinical trial data in the pharmaceutical industry
Advanced statistical computing software skills
Demonstrated programming experience and proficiency with R, R Shiny, tidyverse packages and R Markdown in building advanced R packages and modular Shiny apps (or other development stack)
Excellent knowledge of Good Programming Practices
Ability to perform, coordinate and oversee the preparation, execution, reporting and documentation of all programming deliverables of a project, with minimal supervision.
Strong project management skills




Cytel Inc. is an Equal Employment / Affirmative Action Employer. Applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristics protected by law.




Cytel does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact Cytel’s human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to Cytel. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and Cytel. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of Cytel. Cytel shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies.




#CYTELINT

Title: Adobe Analytics Engineer
text:
A U.S.-based company that is collaborating with key players in the industry to offer them top-notch comprehensive solutions and help them boost their businesses, is looking for an Adobe Analytics Engineer. The engineer will be in charge of tracking particular user interactions, user demographics, and other pertinent dimensions while using custom eVars, props, and events. The company has made a name for itself as the sector's top provider of packaging, shipping, real estate, and mineral solutions. This is an exciting opportunity for engineers who are determined to work in a fast-paced environment and build a lucrative career for themselves.




Job Responsibilities:




Work on legal issues and client compliance simultaneously
Collaborate with a diverse team to complete numerous Adobe projects around the company
Work together with a variety of stakeholders to translate business objectives into requirements for using Adobe Analytics
Create a thorough tagging strategy to gather pertinent data, such as page visits, events, conversions, e-commerce transactions, and custom metrics based on business goals
To install and manage Adobe Analytics tags throughout the organization's online sites, use Adobe Dynamic Tag Manager or alternative tag management tools.
Make sure that data is collected accurately across platforms and devices
Utilizing debugging tools, browser extensions, and Adobe Analytics reporting interfaces, test and confirm the accuracy of the implemented tags
Track data inconsistencies, outliers, and gaps
Work together with other teams to find and fix problems with data quality
Create and maintain segments and classifications to obtain insightful information from unstructured data
To give stakeholders insight, create specialized reports, dashboards, and visualizations utilizing Adobe Analytics reporting tools
Analyze user behavior, user journeys, conversion funnels, and engagement data to find areas for improvement and optimization
To ensure the effective implementation of tracking needs and data integration, collaborate with a variety of departments, including marketing, web development, and data analytics
Keep thorough records of the implementation procedure, tagging plan, data sources, and any customized setups




Job Requirements:




Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a software engineer
Prolific experience and working knowledge of Adobe Analytics
Strong Adobe Analytics implementation skills, including the ability to construct data layers
Some familiarity with Data Extraction is desirable
Nice to have a strong understanding of conversion variables (eVARS) with Adobe
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills

Title: SAP Analytic Engineer
text:
Your Mission




As Analytic Engineer you will be responsible for our SAP Analytics Cloud
You will be leading the BI Reporting and Planning
Also you will work technicaly and architectural with you expertiese of SAC
You will be working in the field of data standards





Your Talents




Bachelor´s degree in one of the following or related fields: Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Management Information Systems or simular
3-6 years of IT experice
At least 3 years of strong experience and deep technical understanding of SAP Analytics Cloud
Architectural, technical and application knowledge expertise of SAC is a must
Knowledge in data standards, procedures and metrics is a nice to have
Its great if you have knowledge in SAP S/4 Embedded Analytics, specifically with Core Date Services
You need to have the ability to work on large cross-functional teams
Excellent verbal & written communication skills
